title: Add-ons (extensions) fail with Firefox 91.0.2
content: None of my favorite extensions work any more. Script blocker, ad blockers, reader, etc. None of them work anymore. The add-ons won't even install. The issue is consistent with 4 different computers running either Windows or Linux. My guess is that recent Firefox software updates made add-ons useless. Is there any word from mozilla developers on the issue? Will third party developers be able to contribute add-ons again? Thanks! Nick
creator: njbetavirp

title: Menus
content: My menu items are now (9/7/2021) White and double-spaced. Why does FireFox change things that don't need changing with no path back. First, they changed menu color to default to another (I think same as Toolbar color) with no recourse. Now the menus are white and double spaced (today! out of the blue sky!!). FireFox, at LEAST make these features configurable. Why do you do this?

title: Dark Theme
content:
Dark Mode used to work beautifully in Firefox. Today it stopped working. I can choose Dark Mode in the settings page, and the settings page itself then uses Dark Mode. But Dark Mode does not work in any of the other pages, only the settings page. I think it must be a flaw in an update that was installed automatically today. (September 7, 2021)

Is there a way to uninstall this update and go back to the previous version. Dark Mode used to work beautifully and Firefox was my favorite browser. Can someone help? Thanks.
creator: cmrus777

title: Google search page functions broken.
content: When I go to google.com and do a search the results page has the "tools" button but it does not work. The "people also ask" categories are also broken (they will not expand), and, if I click the "images" filter button to view images associated with my search it either shows no images (or only a few images) and a bunch of blank boxes. I have found that if I hold the shift key and click the reload button everything is back and working properly until the next time I do a google.com search, then it is back to the same odd behavior. So, my assumption here is that either a cookie or some site data is corrupting the results page for my search. Running Firefox 92.0 (64-bit) on a Windows 7 Dell machine and everything was working fine until about two months ago. Also, Chrome does not show the same behavior. BTW. I have also done everything I have found that was recommended to fix Firefox issues with Google search. Run Firefox in private mode, run without plugins, changed themes, created new profile, I even completely uninstalled Firefox and did a clean install all with the same results. Any help is appreciated. It is almost got me ready to move back to Chrome.
creator: b.j.p.5252

title: Get information from firefox cache
content:
This question is no longer an issue, I got information by reading `.mozilla/firefox/[...]/formhistory.sqlite`. Turns out I used a temporary email months ago and Firefox decided to suggest it now.

Below is the original question:

Hello,

Firefox has cached an email I have never seen before. The email domain is paseacuba.com, which is a temporary email service that I never used before. This computer is my own and no one else uses it.

I noticed this as a suggestion from a form. (Image below)

Could this be explained by any other reason than someone else using this machine ? I was away for the weekend and this happened.

Thank you !
creator: jb.skutnik

I have to do this several times as I use my computer.

title: Malfunction when I press the letter 'a' on keyboard on Lenovo IdeaPad C340 on Windows 10 in Firefox
content: I have this weird problem with my Firefox browser on my Windows 10 PC. It doesn't happen in Chrome or Edge browsers. Not always, but a quiet a few times when I press the letter 'a' on my keyboard when I'm filling out a field in a form or something, it automatically presses enter!? So if I'm typing my email address in a field for example, mr@doma.... the forms takes me to another field or sometimes acts like enter was pressed. The 'a' button is no where near the TAB or ENTER button and I'm not accidentally pressing them. It's driving me crazy and I hope someone can help me fix it as the way this is going, I might have to stop using Firefox which is Not what I want! I have looked online for help but it's hard to find anything like this as I can't even describe the problem?! I went to my google home page, typed this 'firefox presses enter when I type a' to get some help online, but as soon as I typed the last letter 'a', it loaded a page which had nothing to do with what I wrote. Sometimes refreshing the page works than it occurs randomly. I just tried to replicate it but no go.
creator: aus-sam

title: 91.0.1 sürümünden itibaren sorunlar var
content:
Merhabalar,

91.0.1 sürümünden itibaren ciddi sorunlar var. Örneğin herhangi bir indirme başlatılıyor ama sonlandırılamıyor.

Aşağıdaki gibi web sitelerine girdiğinizde resimlerin bulunmadığı sadece linklerin yeraldığı html görüntüsüyle karşılaşılıyor (diğer tarayıcılarda aynı sayfalar açılıyor) https://www.haber7.com/ https://www.milliyet.com.tr/

bazılarında ise sertifika sorunu ekranı ile karşılaşılıyor. Bir de güvenlik sorunu yaşananlar var. https://www.star.com.tr/

Yukarıdaki sorunu kayıtlı yerimlerimin çoğunda yaşıyorum. Bizi Chrome a mahkum etmeyeceğinizi ümit ediyorum.
creator: m_okay

title: I HATE the changes to search facility !
content:
Forever you've been apply to type anything into the Google search bar on the home screen, but not anymore.

Now whateveryou type automatically appear up in the tab line with https// infront of it , then of course it comes back with ...cannot find that web address !!

I'm not looking for a web address, i'm searching a subject matter..

This change is SO annoying I'm now seriously thinking of dumping my much loved Firefox for something which works better.

Why isn't there the 'option' to do search without it 'assuming' you're looking for a web address ?


So Annoying and frustrating, whoever dreamt this idea up....?

title: Restore previous email layout
content: Firefox just updated. I went to check my email and the layout was totally different and all the messages that were in my inbox and junk folder were gone!!! As a matter of fact, ALL of my saved emails and folders are gone!!! Where did they go? How do I get them back? How do I restore the previous Outlook view? It seems as if every time I get used to a layout you change it. This is a crock!!! I save things, such as emails that are important, and I place them in folders that I have created, so I know where they are and you guys just change it and throw away my folders? How do I go back to the previous version of Firefox? Or, how do I go back to the previous version of outlook so I can get my folders, saved emails, as well as my inbox back? If you are going to do this type of thing then give us the option of retaining our emails and the look and feel that we are used to. Some of us have trouble remembering things and change is difficult!!!!
